greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals where the n-th row lists the integers x such that gcd(x, sigma(x)) = n.
comment: First line is A014567 and first column is A074391.
This is a permutation of the positive integers.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: (PARI) triangle(nn) = {v = vector(nn); for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, n, if (! v[k], x = 1, x = v[k] + 1); while (gcd(sigma(x), x) != k, x++); print1(x, ", "); v[k] = x;); print(););}
xref: Cf. A009194 (gcd(n, sigma(n))), A014567 (gcd(n, sigma(n))=1), A074391 (smallest x such that gcd(x, sigma(x)) is n),
results.author: _Michel Marcus_, Jan 14 2015
